Can you also please test if the admin user can still be able to delete all the subscribers - even if its created by operator1/operator2 ?

I think this may disrupt the existing subscribers during the BMC upgrades ? Persisted subscribers who do not have the "owner" entry will not be restored. 

This can be optional parameter correct ?
You may add a BMCWEB_LOG_ERROR here
You may add a BMCWEB_LOG_ERROR here
Some minor cleanups then this looks good to go.
This is already in a "subscription".  This should just be "Owner" or "User"
Please check session pointer for validity before dereferencing.
Isn't this check redundant?  Presumably we can never have an empty string in req.session->username, so this does the same thing as line 577.
This is I think the 4th place this block of code is used.  Please extract it to a method that at least this patchset can use.

If request session is nullprt, it should return the error. But ideally it should not.

If owner field is empty means, you can't create new subscription.

You can fill the insufficient privilege response here itself and avoid passing asyncResp  to isConfigureManagerOrSelf() method.

messages::insufficientPrivilege(asyncResp->res);
One comment, Code looks good to me.
How does this handle the case where a user is renamed?  I don't see code handling for that.

Good catch Ed, Current code can't handle the case if user is renamed. But in such cases, self control will be lost by keep Admin users control intact(Admin's can patch/delete the existing subscription). That said this improve the existing performance anyway, so IMO can be merged as is. Renamed user case can be handled separately and broadly.

This trigger other opens: Do we handle web sessions for renamed user cases? (I mean do we logout the existing open sessions if user is renamed?). Is there any other places also this has to be handled? I will point out if i come across any such.

> That said this improve the existing performance anyway

???  What does this have to do with performance?  I'm not following.

> so IMO can be merged as is. Renamed user case can be handled separately and broadly.

Because we're persisting the Owner into persistent data, I don't think we can, because it would prevent us from fixing it in the future.  Unless someone can articulate a design where, given only the data available here, we could detect a renamed user.
I don't see how this could go on master as-written.  If you have a design for handling renamed users, please, put up a patch describing what you're thinking, or describe it here.

> Do we handle web sessions for renamed user cases?

Yes, but maybe not in the ideal case, but they are eventually timed out.

> (I mean do we logout the existing open sessions if user is renamed?).

Not immediately, but the session expires.  This is reasonable behavior in the session case, but because a Subscription doesn't expire, it has different behavior.

> Is there any other places also this has to be handled?

Probably.
Please pass by Subscription&.   This function does not need to take ownerhsip/

Send response to user about insufficient privilege before return.
messages::insufficientPrivilege(asyncResp->res);
